str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Apart from, separately from; without. Adverb from chora; at a space, i.e. Separately or apart from.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Of persons: incapable; of things: impossible; either the inability, or that which is impossible. Passively, impossible.
To give pleasure to, please (perhaps with the added idea of: rendering good service to). From euarestos; to gratify entirely.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From pros and erchomai; to approach, i.e. come near, visit, or worship, assent to.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A rewarder. From misthoo and apodidomi; a renumerator.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To seek out, seek out after, require. From ek and zeteo; to search out, i.e.investigate, crave, demand, worship.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
